Data: 6.30pm New Zealand won the toss and will bat. Mitchell Santner is out with a knee problem and he's replaced by Ben Wheeler

Kane Richardson to Guptill, FOUR runs fullish, sliding into the pads, 131kph and Guptill skims a leg glance wide of the man on the edge of the ring, Billy Stanlake can't get his rig moving quickly enough and that's a boundary off the first ball
Kane Richardson to Guptill, no run length, around fourth stump, met on the front foot but checked into the covers
Kane Richardson to Guptill, no run touch shorter, 135kph and nibbling in to his the knee roll as Guptill hangs back - high? Maybe heading down
Kane Richardson to Guptill, 2 runs length ball, too straight and Guptill works the ball in front of square, deep square leg has to come across and they trundle through for two
Kane Richardson to Guptill, 1 wide some away swing for Richardson, too wide to begin with
Kane Richardson to Guptill, 1 wide fired down the leg side this time
Kane Richardson to Guptill, no run back of a length around ff stump, defended towards backward point
Kane Richardson to Guptill, FOUR runs pitched up and Guptill stretches forward, thick edge in the aiiiiiiirrrrrrrr... but it whizzes past backward point and runs all the way for four more!
Stanlake to Munro, 3 runs shaping in, good pace on a length, Munro takes it through midwicket this time, picks up three from his first ball
Stanlake to Guptill, FOUR runs oh, nicely done! Cheeky from Guppy, rocking back and using the pace, ramping four over guilly
Stanlake to Guptill, no run touch shorter, 148kph and it's on him quickly, defended down... just past off stump!
Stanlake to Guptill, no run pitched up in the channel and Guptill launches a drive, backing away and freeing the arms, struck firmly but straight to mid-off
Stanlake to Guptill, no run length, 147kph outside off, dabbed towards backward point

Stanlake to Guptill, SIX runs down the ground, smashed for the first six! Guptill is motoring straight away, carves himself a chunk of Stanlake pie - quickly on to the bat and quickly back over long-off, flat and hard
Kane Richardson to Munro, FOUR runs another boundary! Bit of luck this time, Munro forcing at the ball away from his body and thick-edging past his stumps
Kane Richardson to Munro, no run slower ball, Munro skips down and flails at it without connecting
Kane Richardson to Munro, 1 run short ball, 133kph, sits up to be thwacked on the pull, one to deep square leg
Kane Richardson to Guptill, no run pitched up, Guptill swings hard, comes off the inside of the bat to midwicket
Kane Richardson to Guptill, 1 leg bye slightly leg side and it's deflected off the hip
Kane Richardson to Munro, no run short ball, Munro swipes at it - and nearly plays on again! Edged a whisker past off stump, Carey does well to prevent it slipping past him for another streaky four
Stanlake to Guptill, no run length, touching 149kph and Guptill mistimes an aggressive mow
Stanlake to Guptill, SIX runs sweet potato pie, that's massive! Pitched up and hammered way back over the sightscreen, a real golf swing, straight as a die into the stands
Stanlake to Guptill, no run goes very short, trampoline bounce over the crouching batsman
Stanlake to Guptill, 1 run sort ball, Guptll was backing away and had to punch a pull away square

Stanlake to Munro, FOUR runs full and POW! Munro now spanks Stanlake down the ground, looked like it might go straight to mid-off but there was enough biff on the shot to clear the man, one-bounce four!
Stanlake to Munro, 1 run angled across and spiked into the covers, Stoinis takes the pace off it
Tye to Munro, 1 run was that a drop? Munro rather chipped a drive back towards the bowler, Tye looked frustrated to have missed it... went straight through the hands
Tye to Guptill, 1 run taking the pace off, prodded into a gap
Tye to Munro, 1 run length, wobbly around off, Munro dinks it down the ground

Tye to Guptill, SIX runs here he goes again! Cross-seam ball from Tye, he makes a bit of room and splats it over long-off, another easy, breezy swing of the arms - that's the NZ 50 up, from just 28 balls!
Tye to Guptill, no run short, stays back and attempts the ramp, fails to connect
Tye to Guptill, FOUR runs slower ball but it's leg side and Guptill has scooped it over short fine leg! Audacious, gets under it, skips away to the rope again! NZ are flying
Stoinis to Munro, FOUR runs pitched up and lashed towards wide long-off, almost goes for six! Skidding on cross-seam, Munro just bullies through the line, towards the longest part of the ground
Stoinis to Munro, no run shortish, dabbed down behind square
Stoinis to Munro, FOUR runs length, on the pads, Munro brings out his axe and lumberjacks four more to deep backward square leg
Stoinis to Munro, 1 wide banged in, climbing through well over the batsman's head
Stoinis to Munro, 1 run short of a length, 135kph and jabbed into the midwicket area for one
Stoinis to Guptill, no run back of a length outside off, toe-ended into the covers
Stoinis to Guptill, 1 run angled in with the arm and Guptill flicks a single to keep the strike
Agar to Guptill, no run round the wicket, pushed through and chopped towards backward point
Agar to Guptill, 1 run darted flat, touch short but Guptill just prods it into the midwicket gap for one
Agar to Munro, SIX runs flat on the stumps, into Munro's arc and mowed over wide long-on! Flat-batted whack and it sails over the ropes!
Agar to Munro, 1 run tossed up outside off, bludgeoned down the ground to long-off for one
Agar to Guptill, 1 run fired in, Guptill rocks back and heaves a pull to deep midwicket
Agar to Munro, no run pushed through quickly outside leg stump, Munro looks to give it some more pongo over midwicket, but is hit on the pad
Stoinis to Guptill, 1 run on the stumps, worked into a gap leg side
Stoinis to Munro, no run speared in full, 135kph and Munro can only dig it out towards midwicket
Stoinis to Munro, FOUR runs slower ball, pushed across the bows, Munro slashes like Freddy Krueger and it comes off the toe, beats the diving Carey and Stanlake can't reel it in in front of third man
Stoinis to Munro, 1 leg bye full on the pads, whipped fine for one
Stoinis to Guptill, 1 run short ball, sits up to be slugged in front of deep midwicket, Maxwell cuts it off in front of the rope
Stoinis to Munro, 1 run wicket-to-wicket stuff, chopped through the leg side
Agar to Munro, 1 run fired in flat outside leg stump, swung away fine for one
Agar to Guptill, 1 run pushed through on leg and tickled off the pads

Agar to Munro, SIX runs tossed up and crrrrrrrrrrruuuuuuuuuuuunched into the crowd over long-on! This was fast, almost looked like a medium-pace delivery, Munro just whacked it back in the direction whence it came
Agar to Munro, no run pushed back to the bowler
Agar to Munro, 2 runs pushed through and heaved leg side, into a gap at deep midwicket for a couple
Agar to Munro, 1 run floated up and swiped down the ground for one to long-on
Short to Munro, 1 run pushed through and worked back down the ground for one

Short to Guptill, SIX runs tick, tick, tick BOOM! Hits with the spin, nicely into range for the loose-limbed Guptil, who reaches out and slams over long-on - Guptil gets fifty and up comes the NZ 100, too!
Short to Guptill, 1 run looped up and swung away menacingly into the leg side
Short to Munro, SIX runs tossed up and smeared over long-off! Munro goes to fifty with a six, too! Clean drive through the line, almost into the second tier - never mind the small boundaries!
Short to Munro, FOUR runs flat and sliding on with the arm, Munro swivels and slaps it past deep backward square for four!
Short to Munro, 1 run punched down the ground, respite for Aus
Tye to Munro, SIX runs into the crowd again! Munro stays still in the crease and creams it over long-on
Tye to Munro, SIX runs length ball on the pads, Munro hits a flat six over backward square leg! This one does only just clear the rope...
Tye to Munro, SIX runs three in a row!!! This one is massive! Swung over midwicket, goes about 15 rows back into the crowd, Tye being collared here

Tye to Munro, OUT slogged down the ground... but this is pouched at long-on! Australia finally get their breakthrough, Maxwell running around to bag it safely. Didn't quite get hold of this one, Tye back off the canvas, bloodied but not beaten
Tye to Guptill, 1 run on the stumps, punched back in the air, just wide of the bowler
Tye to Seifert, SIX runs hits his first ball for a Dorothy! Full outside off, Seifert steps into line and slots it over long-off, didn't hit it too hard and the ball just plops beyond the rope
Stanlake to Guptill, 1 run back of a length, Guptill slugs it to leg
Stanlake to Seifert, 1 run bowling round the wicket, speared in full, struck on the back leg... Umpire says no, think it just pitched outside leg stump
Stanlake to Guptill, FOUR runs short ball but it's leg side, 143kph and pulled away fine for four, easy pickings
Stanlake to Guptill, 2 runs pitched up full on leg, Guptill flicked it away through backward square leg - and that's the record, most T20I runs for Guptill!
Stanlake to Guptill, 1 run fired in and tapped down the ground
Stanlake to Seifert, FOUR runs full and driven, towards long-off... who slips and lets it through for four more! Brings up the NZ 150 in the process
Agar to Guptill, 1 run lobbed up leg side, slows the pace and Guptill seemed to glove that straight through the keeper, though hard to call it a chance
Agar to Seifert, no run ooh, tries to get cute, going for a reverse-muller over backward point, doesn't get hold of it
Agar to Seifert, 1 run tossed up and flicked firmly towards short fine leg, good fielding prevents it running away
Agar to Guptill, 1 run angled in flat and worked for one

Agar to Seifert, OUT Agar baits the trap, and Seifert picks out deep square leg! Hitting towards the longer part of the ground, against the spin and the connection wasn't good, sailed down the throat of Finch, who holds it safely
Agar to Guptill, 1 run pushed through on middle and leg, Guptill settles for a prod to long-on
Stoinis to Guptill, 1 run short of a length, 130 kays and pulled flat through midwicket

Stoinis to Chapman, no run short ball, pulled into his thigh pad and Chapman wants one, is sent back wisely but Guptill... and Stoinis misses with a toe-end dink towards the stumps with the batsman trying to regain his ground! Think he would just have made it
Stoinis to Chapman, 1 run full outside off, 131kph and punched to long-off along the baize
Stoinis to Guptill, 1 run full toss on leg, bunted through midwicket for one more
Stoinis to Chapman, 1 run short ball, Chapman pulls it to deep midwicket - only singles off this Stoinis over so far

Stoinis to Guptill, SIX runs another full toss and Guptill smokes it over wide long-off to finish the over with another six! Quite a wide line, full extension of the arms, just levered into the boundary boards
Tye to Guptill, 1 run full, taking the pace off, chopped for one
Tye to Chapman, 1 wide angled across, misses the tramlines
Tye to Chapman, 1 run pitched up and swatted towards mid-off, Maxwell's throw is errant
Tye to Guptill, 1 wide fired wide of the off-side line

Tye to Guptill, OUT got him, slogged into the leg side! Guptill finally plinks one short of the rope, Tye gets another, although it was close to being a no-ball... Swung towards deep midwicket from high on the bat and Maxwell again takes the catch coming in off the rope
Tye to Chapman, no run full outside off, gets a swing and a miss
Tye to Chapman, 2 runs sliding across the left-hander, who slices a couple wide of this man
Stanlake to de Grandhomme, 1 run full and straight and swung high to leg, into a gap but just one
Stanlake to Chapman, 1 wide goes round the wicket, slides a full ball down the leg side
Stanlake to Chapman, 2 runs pitched up, flicked firmly off the pads in front of deep midwicket, Stoinis pulls of a good sliding stop on the fence
Stanlake to Chapman, no run slower delivery, bowled it well and Chapman is duped swinging hard outside off
Stanlake to Chapman, 1 run short. 140kph and mistimed on the pull down the ground
Stanlake to de Grandhomme, 1 leg bye back of a length, taking the pace off again and De Grandhomme takes it on the body trying to swing up and over fine leg

Stanlake to Chapman, OUT oof, that's a blow on the helmet - and it's knocked clean off his head and into the stumps! Very unfortunate for Chapman, he's unhurt but he is out... Reminiscent of Pietersen getting out against WI a decade ago, the helmet slipped straight off his head and bounced into the wicket. Stanlake strikes, closing out a decent over
Kane Richardson to Chapman, 1 run pitched up wide of off, chopped through the covers
Kane Richardson to Guptill, no run good bowling, full on off, 132kph and Guptill can only jam down on it
Kane Richardson to Guptill, SIX runs full, taking the pace off, but he's missed the blockhole and Guptill hammers it into the stands! Another full-fat smack down the ground, well back over long-on
Kane Richardson to Guptill, FOUR runs short and wide, sits back and cuts, sends it screaming into a gap, four to deep backward point this time!

Kane Richardson to Guptill, SIX runs length ball, Guptill quietly taps into the covers and straightens his collar pings it back over the head of long-on for six more! Didn't connect cleanly with this but the Eden Park boundaries ensure the fielder isn't in business here
Kane Richardson to Guptill, 1 run short ball, pulled without timing through backward square leg
Stoinis to Guptill, (no ball) SIX runs swung high and handsome over cow corner! Puts it on a length and Guptill puts it into the stand again, moves to within a blow of his hundred!

Stoinis to Guptill, SIX runs short now, Guptill swings savagely, lands the ball on the rope at long-on - that's his century, from 49 balls! Second T20I hundred for Guppy. Think it was a slower ball but it went pretty quickly to the fence, even though he was off balance
Stoinis to Guptill, 1 run full and swatted into the covers
Stoinis to Chapman, 1 run on the stumps, Chapman swings a single through midwicket
Stoinis to Guptill, 1 run full and straight, well bowled, Guptill digs out one through midwicket - raises the NZ 200, with more than four overs to go!

Stoinis to Chapman, 2 runs dropped! Short ball, Chapman picks out deep square leg on the pull... and Finch shells it! He made the ground, should have caught it but the ball hit the fingers and went down
Stoinis to Chapman, FOUR runs full ball, Chapman scuttles across his stumps, ramps it fine for four! Piling on the agony
Kane Richardson to de Grandhomme, 2 runs squirted into the leg side, Maxwell misfields as he attempts to fire in the throw and they come back for two

Kane Richardson to de Grandhomme, OUT bowled 'im! De Grandhomme clears the front leg but is done by the slower ball, thick-edges into his back leg and on to the stumps! Another wicket at the death, Richardson snaffles the dangerous Bigman
Kane Richardson to Williamson, 1 run slower ball again, dabbed square for one
Kane Richardson to Taylor, 1 run pitched up and heaved into the leg side, they think better of coming for two

Kane Richardson to Williamson, OUT full outside off, Williamson chips it to long-off running in! Completely mistimed, think it was a slower ball again from Richardson, floated up and plopped down the ground, Tye taking it well
Kane Richardson to Taylor, 1 run well bowled again, swatted for one by Taylor
Tye to Taylor, 1 run short ball, swung away to square leg on the pull
Tye to Wheeler, no run knuckleball, deceives Wheeler and bounces over he stumps
Tye to Wheeler, 1 run pitched up and whacked down the ground for one

Tye to Taylor, 2 runs dropped! Full toss, muscled towards deep square leg, but Short puts down a straightforward catch! There's then a run-out chance as he fires in the throw but Taylor dives for the line and makes it safely

Tye to Taylor, SIX runs length ball, heaved into the leg side, beyond the rope... and it's been snagged by an orange-clad fella in the crowd! A brilliant one-handed catch, and he goes bananas, because it's worth NZ$50,000, I believe! The Aussies should get him in the team
Tye to Taylor, 1 wide slung wide of the stumps as Taylor steps down
Tye to Taylor, 1 wide again Tye loses his line, into the tramlines and he'll have to bowl it again
Tye to Taylor, SIX runs full toss to finish and Taylor slugs it over the deep midwicket rope! The 18th six of the innings and it takes NZ up to a mighty 243-6 from their 20 overs!
Southee replaces Boult
Southee to Warner, FOUR runs short of a length on leg stump, Warner pulls it off his hip behind square
Southee to Warner, 1 run a touch fuller, at the stumps, heaves across the line and finds deep midwicket...rolled his fingers across it
Southee to Short, 1 run full at middle and leg, flicked off the pads to deep midwicket
Southee to Warner, 1 run full at the stumps, pace off at 119kph, pushed into the covers
Southee to Short, 1 wide short outside leg stump, he goes for the pull and there's a slightly belated appeal for a catch down the leg side...given wide

Southee to Short, FOUR runs dropped! That one was gloved. On leg stump again, Short goes for the pull and it takes the shoulder of the bat - maybe glove as well - but Seifert can't cling on diving to his right
Southee to Short, FOUR runs and that rubs it in, another short one and this time it's pulled away wide of short fine leg
Boult to Warner, 1 run good length outside off, opens the face down to third man...Wheeler does well to cut it off
Boult to Short, FOUR runs another inside edge! And it escapes to the rope...forcing off the back foot, ball shoots past leg stump
Boult to Short, no run pushes a good-length ball to cover
Boult to Short, no run gets the yorker in, at the stumps, dug out back to Boult
Boult to Short, no run back of a length at 140kph, pulled to midwicket...three dots in a row quite something in this match
Boult to Short, 1 wide that goes wrong, a full toss slips down the leg side...Short might feel he missed out
Boult to Short, 2 runs full at off stump, clipped to deep square leg and it's placed well enough for the second...good over from Boult
Wheeler to Warner, no run swings and a miss against a back-of-a-length ball
Wheeler to Warner, SIX runs into the crowd (but not caught this time)...another short ball, this time Warner latches on and clears deep square leg
Wheeler to Warner, 1 wide drags this down the leg side, another wide
Wheeler to Warner, 1 wide another extra ball as a full delivery is pushed down the leg side, trying to cramp Warner for room
Wheeler to Warner, SIX runs over the straight boundary, a back-of-a-length ball which he swings off the front foot over mid-on
Wheeler to Warner, 1 run full at off stump, pushed through the covers
Wheeler to Short, 5 wide another wild short one, the wheel(ers) are a little off for New Zealand at the moment...goes for the bouncer, sails over Short and the keeper
Wheeler to Short, 1 run back on a length, pulled to deep square leg
Wheeler to Warner, 1 run aims for the yorker, it's a low full toss at off stump, not a bad delivery, driven along the ground to long-off...22 off that over
Southee to Warner, 1 run full and straight, driven to mid-off on the edge of the circle
Southee to Short, FOUR runs short on leg stump, pulled effortlessly off his hip and it's a fraction in front of the rope
Southee to Short, 1 run gives himself room outside leg and drives a full delivery down the ground
Southee to Warner, SIX runs that's ridiculous! He's chipped it for six, barely any power. All timing. A full delivery, a little flick of the wrists sends it over mid-off
Southee to Warner, no run goes short, Warner opts to try to go through the off side, moves to leg and it beaten over the top edge...clever change of pace
Southee to Warner, SIX runs over the leg side, into the second tier! Short, pulled over deep square leg...91 off the Powerplay!
Sodhi to Short, 2 runs full outside off, may have been the googly, takes a thick edge towards short third man...and there's an overthrow after a wild return
Sodhi to Short, 1 run short, straight, pulled to deep square leg
Sodhi to Warner, 1 run full outside leg stump, clipped to short fine leg
Sodhi to Short, 2 runs short outside off, another wrong 'un, worked out to deep midwicket
Sodhi to Short, no run a dot ball, a precious thing...trying to take a full delivery from outside off through the leg side
Sodhi to Short, 2 runs touch shorter, flatter, worked through the leg side and more good placement brings a brace
de Grandhomme to Warner, FOUR runs short outside leg stump, basically a long hop, pulled powerfully wide of deep square leg
de Grandhomme to Warner, 1 wide over corrects, goes very full and wide outside off
de Grandhomme to Warner, 2 runs miscues through the leg side, doesn't quite carry to deep square leg...bit of a fumble by Munro
de Grandhomme to Warner, FOUR runs jeepers, it's tough tonight...full outside off, Warner gets a thick outside wide of the keeper to take him to a 20-ball fifty
de Grandhomme to Warner, 1 run good length at the stumps, pushed wide of cover
de Grandhomme to Short, 1 run round the wicket, that's almost conventional cricket, good length at off stump and tapped into point with an open face
de Grandhomme to Warner, 2 runs short outside off, loses his shape as he has a mighty swing, loops off the top edge over point and lands safely
Sodhi to Short, 1 run drags a shortish ball from outside off to deep midwicket
Sodhi to Warner, SIX runs back of a length, stand-and-deliver from Warner, shifts his front leg out of the way and clubs it over long-on
Sodhi to Lynn, 1 run full and straight, another googly, takes a thick inside edge into the leg side
Sodhi to Short, 1 run cut to deep cover
Sodhi to Lynn, 1 run good length at off stump, Lynn comes forward and pushes into point with an open face
de Grandhomme to Lynn, no run gets a bottom edge into his pads as he aims to heave through the leg side
de Grandhomme to Lynn, SIX runs a low full toss, he's not hit it that cleanly, but it sails into the crowd over long-off
de Grandhomme to Lynn, 1 run pulled to deep square leg
de Grandhomme to Short, 1 run round the wicket, flicks a length delivery one bounce to deep square leg

de Grandhomme to Lynn, 2 runs dropped! What a moment that could be...Martin Guptill at deep cover. Well bowled by de Grandhomme, a slower ball into the surface, Lynn couldn't get the distance over the off side but a pretty simple chance is shelled
de Grandhomme to Lynn, 1 run carves a full toss over the off side, Guptill fields this cleanly and there's nearly a mix-up over a second run
Sodhi to Lynn, no run an appeal for lbw as he misses a sweep, probably struck outside the line and spinning to miss off stump
Sodhi to Lynn, 1 run a short delivery, clubbed along the ground to deep midwicket
Sodhi to Short, 1 run a googly outside off, worked into the leg side...half-century off 30 balls
Sodhi to Lynn, 1 wide turn outside off, drives and misses...called wide
Sodhi to Lynn, no run full at the stumps, gets a thick inside edge into his boot
Sodhi to Lynn, FOUR runs full and straight, hammered straight down the ground and the fielders didn't have a hope
Sodhi to Lynn, 1 run that's well bowled, pulled the length back as Lynn came down the pitch, driven straight to cover...a good over from Sodhi in the context of this match
de Grandhomme to Short, SIX runs a length ball gets swing into the stands at deep square leg...into a hospitality box
de Grandhomme to Short, 1 wide very wide outside off, barely on the cut strip...New Zealand have offered up too many extras
de Grandhomme to Short, 1 run length ball outside off, driven sweetly to long-off
de Grandhomme to Maxwell, 1 run full and straight, clipped off the toes into midwicket
de Grandhomme to Short, SIX runs full at off stump, punched with a straight bat over long-on
de Grandhomme to Short, FOUR runs the placement excellent again, pulls a short ball behind square...they just keep going
Wheeler to Maxwell, SIX runs and is sent into the stands, a length ball, Maxwell clears the front leg and deposits it over long-on
Wheeler to Maxwell, FOUR runs moves outside leg again, short of a length, goes over cover this time, wide of the sweeper and just in front of the rope
Wheeler to Maxwell, 1 run what happened there?! Somehow it's got to third. A sharp bouncer, Maxwell is actually trying to let it go by ducking, leaves the bat up and it glances off the face
Wheeler to Short, no run a dot ball! Full outside off, played back to the bowler
Wheeler to Short, 1 run full and straight, inside edge into the pads and it rebounds towards backward point
Wheeler to Maxwell, 1 run short at off stump, pulled to deep square leg
Boult to Maxwell, 1 run round the wicket, full and straight, pushed to long-on
Boult to Short, no run well bowled, gets the yorker in at leg stump, hammers into Short's boot
Boult to Short, FOUR runs a short ball is costly, angled into the body, pulled around the corner and is down to fine leg in the blink of an eye
Boult to Short, 1 run back to full and straight, a low full toss, down to long-on
Boult to Maxwell, FOUR runs what a shot, brilliant from Maxwell...a slower short ball, he stands tall in the crease and ramps it down to third man
Boult to Maxwell, 1 run full at the stumps, they've worked in the over, driven to long-off
Sodhi to Maxwell, SIX runs goes deep in the crease outside leg stump, dragged down short, pulled over deep midwicket
Sodhi to Maxwell, 1 run short again, this time it's not timed as well, pulled straighter down the ground off the toe end
Sodhi to Short, no run a googly outside off, slapped to cover
Sodhi to Short, 1 run outside off, opens the face and pushes square to the off side
Sodhi to Maxwell, no run well bowled! Beaten by a sharp leg-break which bounces as well, good take for Seifert but Maxwell keeps his foot behind the line as they check for the stumping
Sodhi to Maxwell, 1 run pulls a short delivery straight down the ground, one bounce to long-on
Southee to Maxwell, FOUR runs full, straight, drilled...and he almost holds the pose
Southee to Finch, no run beaten first ball, trying to angle a length delivery down to third man...there is a huge appeal for caught behind by Southee. Seifert less excited. No review
Southee to Finch, 1 run driven down the ground to long-on
Southee to Short, 1 run back of a length at off stump, takes a bottom edge and bobbles to the off side
Southee to Finch, 1 run short outside off, pulled to deep midwicket...good over for New Zealand
Wheeler to Finch, (no ball) SIX runs that's costly! A huge full toss, takes a big top edge as Finch swings across the line and it flies down to fine leg
Wheeler to Finch, FOUR runs oh dear, a full toss wide outside off, a free swing for Finch and he gets a thick edge past a diving wicketkeeper

Wheeler to Finch, (no ball) 1 run it's all going badly wrong. Finds deep midwicket where it's taken, is it another no-ball for height?! They are checking it...this will be called again, over waist height. Wheeler is out of the attack after those two full tosses
Boult to Short, 1 run full at off stump, drilled down to long-on and it's caught but won't count
Boult to Finch, 1 run round the wicket, a wide yorker outside off, calmly steered down to third man
Boult to Finch, FOUR runs lovely shot by Finch, Boult came round the wicket, was angling into the pads just a touch and it was flicked past short fine leg
Boult to Finch, SIX runs that's just a nudge down the ground, full outside off and help over long-on with barely any fuss...a lot happened in that over
Southee to Stoinis, no run back of a length, misses an attempt pull and gets smack in the stomach
Southee to Stoinis, 1 run short of a length, helped behind square on the leg side
Southee to Finch, 1 run paddles another short delivery down to fine leg
Southee to Stoinis, 1 run gets underneath this pull but it lands well short of fine leg
Southee to Finch, FOUR runs excellent placement, back of a length outside off, chopped down to third man...the fielder was inside the circle
Southee to Finch, no run beaten this time as he tries to ramp a short ball to third man
de Grandhomme to Stoinis, 1 run full, wide outside off, driven to deep cover
de Grandhomme to Finch, 1 wide a slower short ball, allows it to loop through to the keeper and gets the wide call
de Grandhomme to Finch, 1 run goes full, driven in the air into the leg side, lands between long-on and deep midwicket
de Grandhomme to Carey, 1 run full, wide outside off, carved over point to the sweeper
de Grandhomme to Finch, SIX runs that's the match! Finished, aptly, with another six...a full toss is drilled way back into the crowd at long-on
Well, what an evening that was. I'll wrap things up there. There'll be more reaction on the site over the next few hours. But for now, from Alan and Gnasher, it's goodbye and see you on Sunday.

Australia win by five wickets with the highest T20 chase in history. What an extraordinary match, even with the short boundaries. That winning six was the 32nd of the match and equals the most in a single game. Phew, I need to catch by breath! And, amid all this, the result means England are still alive in the tri-series. They played New Zealand at Hamilton on Sunday. In a match of 488 runs, did the way Australia finished w
Australia won by 5 wickets (with 7 balls remaining)
Player of the match is D'Arcy Short, AUS
